positions.title: Graduate Teaching Assistant
positions.description_html:
Courses Assisted in:

EE352: Basic Electrical Circuits Laboratory (Fall 21, 22, 23, 24)
Training students how to design, build, diagnose, and characterize electronic circuits. Topics include instrumentation, semiconductor devices, and electronic circuits. Covers both analog and digital circuits. Laboratory projects include filters, operational amplifiers, dc power supply, CMOS, logic gates, timing, and counters.

EAS200: Electrical Engineering Concepts for Non Majors. (Spring 22)
Introduces aspects of electrical engineering useful to all the engineering disciplines. Course material includes basic circuit analysis and networks, fundamentals of electromagnetics, energy conversion and transmission.


EE 178: Digital Principles (Spring 24)
Topics include: number systems; digital arithmetic including adders and multipliers; Boolean algebra; minimization techniques; logic design; programmable logic devices; memory types and devices; registers; counters; synchronous sequential networks; throughput and latency; and pipelining.
